title: Kirchhoff junction - rank currents in 4 resistors

content.question: Four identical resistors are connected to a battery in a circuit, as shown in the figure. <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="I sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="I sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math> are the currents in resistors <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares the four currents?

choices.label: <math alttext="I sub 1, equals I sub 2, which equals I sub 3, which equals I sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="I sub 1, is greater than open parenthesis, I sub 2 equals I sub 3, close parenthesis, which is greater than I sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="I sub 1, is greater than I sub 2, which is greater than open parenthesis, I sub 3 equals I sub 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="I sub 1, is greater than open parenthesis, I sub 2 equals I sub 3, which equals I sub 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="I sub 1, is greater than I sub 2, which is greater than open parenthesis, I sub 3 equals I sub 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>4</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
